title: Postponed Authentication Fixes: Persistent 401 Unauthorized
body:
# Postponed Authentication Fixes

## Issue Description
Authentication system logic is implemented but currently disabled due to persistent `401 Unauthorized` errors on the `/api/auth/me` endpoint after login/registration.

## Symptoms
- `POST /api/auth/register` and `POST /api/auth/login` succeed (return 200/201 and JWT token).
- `GET /api/auth/me` fails with `401 Unauthorized`.
- Backend logs show successful requests but then 401.
- `Bcrypt` length limit (72 bytes) issues were encountered and partially patched in `crypto.py`.

## Current State
- `PrivateRoutes` wrapper removed in `App.jsx`.
- Auth pages (`/login`, `/register`) are accessible but not mandatory.
- Backend `run_server.py` probably needs a full clean restart or environment check.

## TODO to Restore Auth
1. Debug `src/auth/service.py` -> `get_current_user` logic. Verify JWT decoding matches the encoding algorithm (`HS256`) and Secret Key.
2. Ensure Frontend Axios instances send `Authorization` header correctly (check `axios.js` defaults vs interceptors).
3. Check if `python-jose` requires `cryptography` backend explicit initialization on Windows/Proactor loop.
4. Re-enable `PrivateRoutes` in `App.jsx` when stable.
